abstract: Federal prosecutors file new criminal count against former New York State Assembly Speaker Sheldon Silver, charging him with abusing his office in order to receive almost $4 million in illicit payments through two law firms.
lead_paragraph: Sheldon Silver, the former Assembly speaker, is accused of abusing his office in order to obtain nearly $4 million in illicit payments through two law firms.

headline.main: Sheldon Silver Faces New Charge in Corruption Case
headline.print_headline: Former Speaker Faces New Charge in Corruption Case

snippet: Sheldon Silver, the former Assembly speaker, is accused of abusing his office in order to obtain nearly $4 million in illicit payments through two law firms.
